00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_blob_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_blob_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 #include "oid.h"
00031 #include "object.h"
00032 
00033 /**
00034  * @file git2/blob.h
00035  * @brief Git blob load and write routines
00036  * @defgroup git_blob Git blob load and write routines
00037  * @ingroup Git
00038  * @{
00039  */
00040 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * Lookup a blob object from a repository.
00044  * The generated blob object is owned by the revision
00045  * repo and shall not be freed by the user.
00046  *
00047  * @param blob pointer to the looked up blob
00048  * @param repo the repo to use when locating the blob.
00049  * @param id identity of the blob to locate.
00050  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00051  */
00052 GIT_INLINE(int) git_blob_lookup(git_blob **blob, git_repository *repo, const git_oid *id)
00053 {
00054         return git_object_lookup((git_object **)blob, repo, id, GIT_OBJ_BLOB);
00055 }
00056 
00057 /**
00058  * Create a new in-memory git_blob.
00059  *
00060  * The blob object must be manually filled using
00061  * the 'set_rawcontent' methods before it can
00062  * be written back to disk.
00063  *
00064  * @param blob pointer to the new blob
00065  * @param repo The repository where the object will reside
00066  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00067  */
00068 GIT_INLINE(int) git_blob_new(git_blob **blob, git_repository *repo)
00069 {
00070         return git_object_new((git_object **)blob, repo, GIT_OBJ_BLOB);
00071 }
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * Fill a blob with the contents inside
00075  * the pointed file.
00076  *
00077  * @param blob pointer to the new blob
00078  * @param filename name of the file to read
00079  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00080  */
00081 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_blob_set_rawcontent_fromfile(git_blob *blob, const char *filename);
00082 
00083 /**
00084  * Fill a blob with the contents inside
00085  * the pointed buffer
00086  *
00087  * @param blob pointer to the blob
00088  * @param buffer buffer with the contents for the blob
00089  * @param len size of the buffer
00090  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00091  */
00092 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_blob_set_rawcontent(git_blob *blob, const void *buffer, size_t len);
00093 
00094 /**
00095  * Get a read-only buffer with the raw content of a blob.
00096  *
00097  * A pointer to the raw content of a blob is returned;
00098  * this pointer is owned internally by the object and shall
00099  * not be free'd. The pointer may be invalidated at a later
00100  * time (e.g. when changing the contents of the blob).
00101  *
00102  * @param blob pointer to the blob
00103  * @return the pointer; NULL if the blob has no contents
00104  */
00105 GIT_EXTERN(const void *) git_blob_rawcontent(git_blob *blob);
00106 
00107 /**
00108  * Get the size in bytes of the contents of a blob
00109  *
00110  * @param blob pointer to the blob
00111  * @return size on bytes
00112  */
00113 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_blob_rawsize(git_blob *blob);
00114 
00115 /**
00116  * Read a file from the working folder of a repository
00117  * and write it to the Object Database as a loose blob,
00118  * if such doesn't exist yet.
00119  *
00120  * @param written_id return the id of the written blob
00121  * @param repo repository where the blob will be written
00122  * @param path file from which the blob will be created
00123  */
00124 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_blob_writefile(git_oid *written_id, git_repository *repo, const char *path);
00125 
00126 /** @} */
00127 GIT_END_DECL
00128 #endif
